definitions.definition: The use of "damn" as a curse.
definitions.example: He said a few damns and left.

definitions.definition: A small, negligible quantity, being of little value; a whit or jot.
definitions.example: The new hires aren't worth a damn.

definitions.definition: The smallest amount of concern or consideration.
To condemn; to declare guilty; to doom; to adjudge to punishment.
To put out of favor; to ruin; to label negatively.
definitions.example: I’m afraid that if I speak out on this, I’ll be damned as a troublemaker.

definitions.definition: To condemn as unfit, harmful, invalid, immoral or illegal.
To curse; put a curse upon.
definitions.example: That man stole my wallet. Damn him!
That car was going damn fast!

definitions.definition: Used to express anger, irritation, disappointment, annoyance, contempt or suprise, etc. See also dammit.
